briefdescription.para: The lower bounds of the objective function arguments.
The upper bounds of the objective function arguments.
Maximum capacity of the evaluation store.
Number of iterations after which the evaluation memory is sorted.
Dimensionality of the problem space.
Shared 2D array for storing the evaluated points in the search space.
Shared array for storing the corresponding function values.
Counter for the total number of evaluations performed.
Counter for the number of optimization runs.
Counter for the number of currently stored evaluations.
Counter for the number of recorded statistics.
Reference time for tracking durations.
Running mean of function values in the store.
Running squared mean difference for standard deviation calculation.
Best objective function value found so far.
Coordinates of the point corresponding to the best objective function value.
Number of statistics points to record.
Array for storing timestamps of improvements.
Array for storing values of improvements.
Index for the next statistic to record.
Counter for total evaluations stored for statistics.
Current best value stored for statistics tracking.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, Callable[[ArrayLike], float] fun, Bounds bounds, Optional[int] check_interval=10, Optional[int] capacity=500, Optional[int] statistic_num=0)
memberdef.name: __init__

briefdescription.para: Initializes an instance to manage shared memory for evaluating fitness functions with capabilities for storing results, maintaining statistics, and handling bounds in a multiprocessing environment.

para.verbatim: fun (Callable[[ArrayLike], float]): The fitness function to evaluate.

parameterdescription.para: The bounds of the objective function arguments.
The interval (in iterations) to sort the evaluation memory. Default is 10.
The maximum capacity of the evaluation store. Defaultis500. statistic_num (Optional[int]): The number of statistics to maintain. If greater than 0, statistics tracking is enabled. Default is 0.

briefdescription.para: Evaluates a given function with input data, tracks evaluation statistics, and updates the best observed value if applicable.

parameterdescription.para: Input data for the function evaluation.

simplesect.para: float The function output for the given input.

briefdescription.para: Generates an array of improvements based on time and value up to a specific index.

para.verbatim: This method combines the time and value attributes into a NumPy array of tuples, containing the data up to the si attribute's value. The method assumes that the attributes `time` and `val` are iterable and contain corresponding elements. The method is useful for analyzing the progression or trend present within the provided values.

simplesect.para: numpy A NumPy array of tuples where each tuple is composed of elements from time and val attributes up to the index indicated by si.

parameterdescription.para: If `time` or `val` attributes are not iterable or do not contain corresponding elements.
If `si.value` exceeds the lengths of `time` or `val` attributes.

briefdescription.para: Calculates statistics for the provided number of samples by segmenting and mapping values based on time intervals.

detaileddescription.para: This method segments a range of time into equal intervals based on the given number of samples. It then maps each interval to the corresponding value at the closest timestamp within that interval.

parameterdescription.para: The number of intervals or samples for which statistics are calculated.

simplesect.para: List A list of values corresponding to the calculated statistics for each interval.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of evaluations specified.

para.verbatim: This method accepts the maximum number of evaluations as an integer input and simply returns it unchanged. It is commonly used to track or specify the number of steps or iterations allowed in a process.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum number of evaluations to be returned.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, int i, float y, ArrayLike xs)
memberdef.name: replace

briefdescription.para: Replaces the values at a specified index with new values.

para.verbatim: This method updates the y-value and x-values at the specified index by calling internal methods.

parameterdescription.para: Index at which the replacement occurs.
New y-value to set at the specified index.
New x-values to set at the specified index.

briefdescription.para: Sort entries to retain the best ones, thereby optimizing storage for new entries.

para.verbatim: This method sorts the stored entries based on their associated values, retains the top 90% (as determined by the capacity), and updates the internal data structures to reflect the new ordering and count of retained entries. It subsequently returns the updated number of stored entries.

simplesect.para: int The number of stored entries after sorting and truncating to the top 90%.

memberdef.argsstring: (self, float y, ArrayLike x, int evals, limit=np.inf)
memberdef.name: add_result

briefdescription.para: Adds a result to the data structure, updating statistical values and recording the given data point.

detaileddescription.para: It updates attributes like the best value (best_y) and associated point (best_x), checks storage capacity, and computes statistical measures.

parameterdescription.para: The new value to be added.
The associated data point corresponding to the value y.
Number of evaluations associated with the newly added data. limit (float, optional): The maximum cap for y values to be considered. Default is np.inf.
If the input data is inconsistent or violates preconditions of the data structure. (Error not directly visible in provided code)

briefdescription.para: Retrieves a copy of the best_x attribute as a numpy array.

simplesect.para: np A copy of the current best_x attribute, converted to a numpy array.

briefdescription.para: Creates and initializes a view for the 'xs' object.

para.verbatim: This method generates a view from the 'xs' object and assigns it to the `xs_view` attribute. It is essential to call this method in the target process to properly initialize the `xs_view`.

parameterdescription.para: If 'xs' does not have a 'view()' method or is not

briefdescription.para: Returns a view of the stored elements up to the count specified by num_stored.

para.verbatim: Retrieves a NumPy array with the elements stored up to a set boundary, defined by `num_stored.value`. This method utilizes the array's view functionality for efficient data access without additional memory allocation.

simplesect.para: np A NumPy array view with elements up to the specified count.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the y-coordinate value corresponding to a given particle ID.

parameterdescription.para: The particle ID whose y-coordinate is to be retrieved.

simplesect.para: float The y-coordinate value associated with the specified particle ID.

briefdescription.para: Returns the best y-value.

para.verbatim: This method retrieves the best y-value currently stored in the `best_y` attribute. The value is returned as a floating-point number.

simplesect.para: float The best y-value stored in the best_y attribute.

briefdescription.para: Gets the stored y-values as a NumPy array.

para.verbatim: This method retrieves the stored y-values up to the current number of stored values and returns them as a NumPy array.

simplesect.para: np A NumPy array containing the y-values.

briefdescription.para: Calculates and returns the mean value along the Y-axis.

para.verbatim: This method retrieves the precomputed mean value for the Y-axis from the `mean` attribute and returns it.

simplesect.para: float The mean value along the Y-axis.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the standard deviation based on the collected statistics.

para.verbatim: This method calculates the standard deviation for the y-values from statistical data. If no statistical runs have been recorded, it returns 0 to avoid division by zero.

simplesect.para: float The standard deviation of the y-values from the statistical data. Returns 0 if there are no recorded statistical runs.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current evaluation count value.

para.verbatim: This method returns the integer value of the current evaluation count, allowing users to access the internal evaluation counter's value for further processing or inspection.

simplesect.para: int The current count of evaluations.

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current value of count_runs, representing the count of runs.

simplesect.para: int The current count of runs.

briefdescription.para: Compares the current run count with the specified limit and increments the count if it is below the given limit.

parameterdescription.para: The maximum limit up to which the run count can be incremented.

simplesect.para: bool True if the run count was incremented, False otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Increases the count of evaluations and performs sorting based on a condition.

para.verbatim: This method increments the evaluation counter (`count_evals`) by the specified value and performs a sort operation if the current number of runs (`count_runs`) is one less than a multiple of the check interval (`check_interval`).

parameterdescription.para: The number of evaluations to add to the current count.

briefdescription.para: Dumps debugging information if debugging is active.

para.verbatim: This method obtains and processes data related to evaluations, computed values (Ys), and other statistics, then logs a formatted message for debugging purposes.
